com.google.publicalerts.cap

Class CapDateUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.publicalerts.cap.CapDateUtil

  • public class CapDateUtil extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for dealing with transforming to and from the CAP timestamp format.

      • toJavaDate

        public static java.util.Date toJavaDate(java.lang.String dateStr)
        Converts a date string in [datetime] format to a java date
        Parameters:
        dateStr - the string to convert
        Returns:
        the date, or null if the date is invalid

      • formatCapDate

        public static java.lang.String formatCapDate(java.util.Calendar cal)
        Formats the given date as a [datetime].
        Parameters:
        cal - the date and time zone to format
        Returns:
        a string of the form "2011-10-28T12:00:01+00:00"

      • getTimezoneOffset

        public static int getTimezoneOffset(java.lang.String dateStr)
        Returns the timezone offset, in minutes, between the given dateStr and UTC.

        For example, if dateStr is 2003-04-02T14:39:01+05:00, this method would return 300. If dateStr is 2003-04-02T14:39:01-01:29, this method would return -89.

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String dateStr)
        Returns true if the given string is a valid date according to the CAP spec
        Parameters:
        dateStr - the string to parse
        Returns:
        true if the given string is a valid date according to the CAP spec
